result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

This case needed to be called on the record for victim rights.  New plea/sent date set. Bond Continues. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

DC(USE OF DANGEROUS WEAPON)
CONDITIONS:   No contact with V1 & V2 in Oshkosh PD report #22-16685.   No contact with the 400 block of Boyd St. Oshkosh. Absolute Sobriety.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons. Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program (MAY BE SUSPENDED WHILE IN INPATIENT TREATMENT AND A RELEASE HAS BEEN SIGNED FOR THE STATE). If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.
